alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Kearney; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 18 at 2:11PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A Quick Hit of Snow and Blowing Snow Could Cause At Least Minor Travel Issues This Afternoon... Although these counties are not currently included in a formal Winter Weather Advisory due to the expectation that new snowfall accumulation today will be less than 1 inch, the combination of briefly-heavier bursts of snow and north winds gusting as high as around 35 MPH could still cause at least brief visibility reductions, slick roads and at least minor blowing and drifting snow issues this afternoon, including for the evening commute. All falling, accumulating snow will end from west to to east across the area between 4 and 6 PM, but mainly minor blowing snow issues could linger well into this evening before winds gradually subside overnight. Please be ready for rapidly changing, wintry weather conditions this afternoon, despite the lack of a formal Winter Weather Advisory.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Kearney; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster
